ratings.comment: CS435 was very enjoyable. Lectures were well organized & helpful. Not recorded, so attendance was necessary to learn the content well (but not required). Homeworks are difficult but interesting to work through for someone interested in the subject. Exams are easier than HWs. Bach is available plenty outside of class and is very helpful during OHs.

CS787 advanced algorithms is a hard course. Prof Bach made the course approachable. He was willing to explain the topic and answer questions, whichever is asked at class. He definitely made it less intimidating to learn. Workload is average (2 hws + 1 exams).

Professor Bach is a nice enough guy, but he is a terrible professor! He presents the material without any real clear direction, and half the time stands in front of what he just wrote, making note-taking a nightmare. The homeworks are impossible, but the exams tend to be a little easier and you can muddle your way through them. AVOID!

Bach is quite good. He's a little old school and only lectures on a chalkboard, however, he tries to put up relevant material on the website. He's slow to grade, but overall, a very good professor who knows his stuff. He also writes his own fresh problem sets fresh every semester with novel problems and takes feedback actively for class

Extremely difficult professor, all of the material is presented at a ridiculously high level. A lot of the times I looked up alternative lectures. Homework is near impossible, and expects you to know terminology and material covered in CS240 (i.e. proof techniques), despite the fact that it's listed as optional. At least the exams were easy.

Professor Bach is kind and clearly very knowledgeable regarding cryptography, but in no way does it translate to being a good instructor. He works strictly on a chalkboard, covers his work most the time, explains complex ideas in vague symbols, has confusing lectures, and assumes us to understand his proofs before he trails off. AVOID AT ALL COSTS!

Underrated Professor! I thought Professor Bach was great. I wish more UW professors were like him.

That said- his class is very hard. The lectures are abstract, and it takes a lot of effort to understand the material well. But this is very good if you want to learn the material.

I would take another class taught by Professor Bach. 5/5

Bach is a terrible professor. While he knows his stuff he is terrible at teaching it. Don't expect things to be graded until months after submission. The worst part is that he won't even tell you the grade cutoffs until the very end of class, so you could be failing and you don't even know since he won't say the curve. WORST professor I've ever had
Bach is a good dude and is very passionate and knowledgeable about the material, doesn't translate at being great at actually teaching it. Most lectures did not really make a ton of sense overall.

lectures are not helpful to Exams and HWs at all. Even discussion sections by TAs are significantly more useful. Also, my HW was misgraded, Professor refuses to change my grade and told me to email the grader instead, but my HW grader doesn't even reply to any messages/emails, so even getting correct grading is not always possible.

Bach's 577 is such a disgrace to UW-Madison. Why is he teaching the most fundamental class in the CS degree? The content of lectures makes so much sense if you take Bach and his ramblings out of the equation. HWs take months to be graded, exams - 5 weeks. Don't take this class with him if you want to learn algorithms.

Avoid this professor at all costs. Homework's are downright impossible, exams are really hard as well. Lectures are incredibly boring and you basically have to teach yourself everything. Take any other professor
He is a smart guy, but not a good teacher. Do not take this course with him, you will learn nothing. Hw is impossible, average for midterm was 18/40, like seriously do not take this guy...

Bach is easily one of the worst professors I have ever had. DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE WITH BACH. He rambles on about noting during lecture and gives 0 examples. You will spend more time figuring out what the questions are asking than actually solving them. The midterm took around 1 month to be graded. Avoid Bach at ALL costs!!

People say Dieter's section is the hardest one. No, Eric Bash teaches the hardest CS577. Some of his material has never been taught by other CS 577 professors, such as FFT. That means you learn a lot and suffer a lot as well. His homework is challenging but he is a very nice guy in office hour and would give you tons of hints. I like him overall.

DO NOT TAKE FOR CS577. TAKE ANYONE ELSE. Eric Bach is a truly horrible teacher. You will learn nothing. The worst part is that some of the stuff you are supposed to learn in this class could be useful, you just won't learn it with Eric.

Bach is clearly an intelligent man but his teaching is very disorganized. Worst and most poorly taught class I've taken at UW. Bach just writes symbols on the board without explaining what they are and rambles on about an irrelevant proof. He is extremely disorganized and exams are impossible. He didn't even bring enough exams sheets to the final.

WORST PROFESSOR EVER! He can't teach and just rambles on. Lecture notes are useless and the homework isn't doable since he makes it not searchable on the internet for hints. Words them very confusingly. No way to study for exams. JUST AVOID THIS PROF!

Lectures are useless because he teaches at a much higher level than the class requires. He will stand in front of the board, blocking it, write out a whole proof you can't follow audibly, then you have to attempt to piece it together from what he wrote once you actually can see it. Also homework is impossible. The average is always like 5/10.

You can tell that Bach is very knowledgable in the material taught in CS435, but he is borderline useless in conveying that material to students. Homework in this class is very intense, and each assignment contains at least one problem that has never been discussed in class or in his lecture notes. Full examples are almost never shown anywhere.

Bach has a loose structure to his lectures and often rambles through examples/explanations. He will begin doing an example and won't finish it, instead saying, "well you get the point". His homework is much more involved than what he teaches in lecture, and even the notes don't help with some of the problems he assigns. Do not take 435 with him.
The lectures leave people quite clueless as to what is going on. He doesn't use canvas at all and has a very minimal site made with just text and links to homework.

He is not that scary... Some lectures are pretty confusing, which I left having no ideas what he was talking about. He is very good outside of the lecture tho. He gives tons of help in his OH. Overall you will learn a lot from him.

Just teaches a bunch of different algorithms with a very loose structure. Be familiar with the algorithms but don't stress over them, class tests more on your deductive reasoning than your understanding of the course.

An ideal teacher for this course.  He intuitively understands the material and has the ability to immediately grasp the perspective of the student asking a question.  This stuff is abstract, Prof Bach makes it approachable.  He is easily reachable, responsive and appears to truly care about both his students and the material.

HWs are random questions, and everything is too theoretical. The most useful proof in this class will be "Now it should be clear that...". It's not a good course if you really want to learn algorithm.  Most students go to the other section because this guy just doesn't know how to teach. He sucks.

Dr. Bach is a very smart man but isn't  a easy grader. To want to pass you have to be interested in CS if you aren't the homework will feel like a chain on your leg. In my opinion hes a tough grader and isn't the best but if you want a boost know what your doing wrong and are very interested in CS he'd be the one for you.

He's the worst professor I've ever had. Never take a class with him. There were 4 exams: first average was a 26%, second was 35%, third was 36%, and the final average wasn't posted it was that bad. The exams were multiple choice... He doesn't know how to teach, and he doesn't know how to dumb it down at all. He couldn't have been worse..
Hard class but doable. If you can't get this class with deb take it with Eric.

Absolutely worthless professor from my experience in Discrete Math. No, the material is not great, but it was extremely difficult to understand. When the first exam came around and an A was 20%, I dropped. When I went to ask for help, he offered the suggestion to "just write a program to solve it for you". Take 240 with Math Dept instead!
Just terrible. Made everything so unnecessarily hard that we missed the key concepts of discrete math. I feel robbed of the knowledge that class should have offered.
It's all been said. He's a very bad teacher. Thinking of taking his class? Don't.
He wasn't clear.  The book wasn't clear. The homework was incredibly difficult.  The exams were too, and they were worth 90% of your grade total with each exam average under 50%.
Easily the worst class I've ever taken, and the worst professor I've ever had.

The worst 240 professor I have ever seen.  I know people that have taken this course with other professors and they do not understand what Bach is trying to teach.  His methods are unclear, he is terrible at getting his point across and he blames the students for his inability to teach.
Finally finished the worst class in history! Absolutely terrible time.
Probably the best teacher you can take 240 with especially if you're going to be a CS major. If I could take the class again, I definitely would.

Terrible teacher. Lecture is pointless as nothing you will be doing on the homework is related. Homework is difficult to the point of absurdity, and the exams are stupid hard. Whatever you do don't take any classes with this excuse for a teacher.

Extremely difficult. It definitely doesn't need to be this hard but his class definitely challenges you to learn everything very well.  The problem is, his impossible homeworks and teaching style forces you to learn almost everything on your own

Worst professor I've ever had. Completely impossible to understand. The homeworks given are hard to the point of impossible (I've put in an un-godly amount of time, and gotten nowhere.) The average on the first test was a 33% (after almost half the class dropped the course).

A nice guy, but his teaching style is not the most helpful, and his exam/HW questions are needlessly convoluted (i.e. he tries to be "creative") and thus much more difficult than the content of the class calls for.

There is no doubt that Eric is very smart, the only problem is that he is used to teaching higher level undergrad and grad courses. Not the right fit for a class that is trying to teach the basics of many different topics. Unfortunately it is required for CS, so we have to deal with it. I'll be happy to get out with a B and never look back!

This class is very hard, definitely. The main issue with Dr. Bach is his tendency to go very fast. If he would slow down a bit and provide more solid examples, I think the class would be much better. Far too often, he'll make a statement and say, "Right?" as if asking if we follow. Better to SHOW us.

This course with Eric was very difficult and I dropped it. I think he means well and is intelligent but the concepts are not meant to be this hard and I doubt any amount of studying could have helped me prepare for that exam. I would not take him if you want a reasonable workload and exams that test you on the material. Wait a semester if you can.

The class is very difficult and it appears he wants you to fail. Homework is next to impossible and the tests are impossible. His class started out with 250 students and now has less than 80. Lecture, textbook, homework, and tests have no correlation making it impossible to study for. Worst teacher ever, don't take.

The worst professor I have ever had with impossible tests! The average for the first midterm was 33% after the vast majority of people dropped the class. This is the first time I have ever failed a test, let alone received negative points! Yes, you could actually go negative, but he said he was nice enough to bump you up to 0!

I got an A in Math 222 and had to drop this course. His homework is impossible and you can score negative points on exams. Well over 60% dropped course. Worst teacher ever. This course isn't suppose to be a weed out. Positive ending, he does know what he is talking about.

I have no doubt Eric Bach understand the material required in Discrete Mathematics. However, when I signed up for this class, I quickly learned I had no resources to learn the material. The professor cannot convey his ideas clearly, and the book he is using has been consistently rated poorly on a number of online book stores. Avoid his class.

To be honest, before I take this class, I am very exited. He is the worst prof I have ever seen. Materials are not suppose to be hard but he made it so difficult for me to understand. Lecture contents and homework are completely different. Questions are sometimes confusing. This is a 3 credit class but I am spending more time than a 4 credit class.

The worst professor I have ever had the misfortune to have. He is unable to effectively communicate with students and is just all around a lousy professor. I am learning nothing in his class and quite honestly I don't plan to at the current rate. My suggestion, stay away from this man and all of his teachings because he has nothing to offer you.
CS240, a course that is supposed to be super easy. But He made it hard as hell! HW Assignments that are impossible to finish or even understand and non-useful lectures... just don't take his class!

Obscenely difficult class. Expects you to do 40 hours of work per assignment (1 assignment/2 weeks) - he told this to me personally. Likes writing almost nonstop and talking while facing the chalkboard.
If you are interested in the material, he is definitely better than some other profs.  I personally got a lot out of his class.  The homeworks were very difficult.
he's a nice guy and very knowledgable - but his class isn't made to teach you, it's meant to trick you with super impossible homework assignments.
pretty nice guy and an OK teacher - but his class isn't engineered to teach you anything. it's meant to trick you up.
Too hard. Take it with Deb Joseph. She's a much better teacher.
Not always an enaging lecturer, but a very good teacher overall.  Recommended.
Reading a textbook is more exciting than listening to his lectures.
Teaching is an Art.  He is a maestro
